qas.question: What area uses traditional Chinese characters?

context: In the Republic of China (<a2_0>Taiwan<a2_0/>), which uses traditional Chinese characters, the Ministry of Education's Chángyòng Guózì Biāozhǔn Zìtǐ Biǎo (常用國字標準字體表, Chart of Standard Forms of Common National Characters) lists 4,808 characters; the Cì Chángyòng Guózì Biāozhǔn Zìtǐ Biǎo (次常用國字標準字體表, Chart of Standard Forms of Less-Than-Common National Characters) lists another 6,341 characters. The Chinese Standard Interchange Code (CNS11643)—<a0_0>the official national encoding standard<a0_0/>—supports 48,027 characters, while the most widely used encoding scheme, <a1_0>BIG-5<a1_0/>, supports only 13,053.
